meanings.definition: Seeking to imitate or surpass someone or something, especially through competition.
meanings.sent1: The young artist's emulative nature drove her to practice for hours to match the skill of her favorite painter.
meanings.sent2: Her emulative attitude in the race pushed her to run faster and beat her personal best time.
meanings.sent3: The emulative student tried to copy her classmate's test answers but ended up getting caught.
meanings.sent4: His emulative spirit soared as he aimed to outshine his older brother in every aspect.
meanings.sent5: The emulative rivalry between the two siblings fueled their constant efforts to outdo each other.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a desire to emulate or imitate others.
meanings.sent1: The emulative behavior of the young child was evident as he mimicked his older sister's every move.
meanings.sent2: She had an emulative personality, always trying to copy the fashion sense of her favorite celebrities.
meanings.sent3: The emulative monkey in the zoo amused visitors by imitating the gestures of the zookeeper.
meanings.sent4: Her emulative nature shone through as she adopted her mentor's teaching style in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The emulative student eagerly absorbed the techniques of the master painter to improve her own art skills.
